title: Protean progenitor
data:
***Version [0.32](/0.32 "0.32")**: This article is up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of *Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup*.*

*For a list of all giants, see [list of giants](/List_of_giants "List of giants").*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A gargantuan humanoid of fractured shape from the aeons when the seas were but primordial soup. The many shapeshifters of the dungeon once sloughed off from these unfathomably ancient beings, and when they themselves finally cease, even their remains will give birth one last time to furious monsters. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 Spells](#Spells)
- [4 Aspiring flesh](#Aspiring_flesh)
- [5 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks_2)
- [6 History](#History)
- [7 References](#References)

## Useful Info

**Protean progenitors** are primordial, [unstable](/Chaotic "Chaotic"), and giant monsters. On their own, they are fast, hit hard, regenerate very quickly and cast [Irradiate](/Irradiate "Irradiate"). On death, they will split into [aspiring flesh](#Aspiring_flesh). They appear in the [Realm of Zot](/Realm_of_Zot "Realm of Zot") and the domain of [Mnoleg](/Mnoleg "Mnoleg"), usually in pairs.

## Tips & Tricks

- Protean progenitors are essentially more dangerous [Orb Guardians](/Orb_Guardian "Orb Guardian") that appear in pairs. Try to fight them individually.
- Try not to remain in melee range with them for too long, or you could end up severely [contaminated](/Contamination "Contamination").
- Due to their very fast regeneration, if you disengage from a battle with them for even a short amount of time they will likely have recovered back to full health.
- Protean progenitors are vulnerable to [silver](/Silver "Silver").

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                            |                                                     |
| :---------- | ------------------------------------------ | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Irradiate](/Irradiate "Irradiate") (3d25) | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Aspiring flesh

| aspiring flesh \* [![Aspiring flesh.png](/images/8/83/Aspiring_flesh.png)](/File:Aspiring_flesh.png) |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [HP](/Hit_points "Hit points")                                                                       | 87-177                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| [HD](/Hit_dice "Hit dice")                                                                           | 12                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| [XP](/XP "XP")                                                                                       | 0                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| [Speed](/Monster_speed "Monster speed")                                                              | 10 (stationary)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| [AC](/Armour_class "Armour class")                                                                   | 2                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| [EV](/Evasion "Evasion")                                                                             | 0                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| [Will](/Willpower "Willpower")                                                                       | Immune                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| [Resistances](/Resistance "Resistance")                                                              | [rDrown](/Asphyxiation "Asphyxiation") [rPois+](/Poison "Poison")                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| [Vulnerabilities](/Vulnerability "Vulnerability")                                                    | None                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| [Habitat](/Habitat "Habitat")                                                                        | Amphibious                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| [Intelligence](/Monster_intelligence "Monster intelligence")                                         | [Brainless](/Category:Brainless_intelligence "Category:Brainless intelligence")                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| [Uses](/Item_usage "Item usage")                                                                     | [Uses nothing](/Category:Uses_nothing "Category:Uses nothing")                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| [Holiness](/Holiness "Holiness")                                                                     | [Natural](/Category:Natural_holiness "Category:Natural holiness")                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| [Size](/Size "Size")                                                                                 | [Large](/Category:Large_monsters "Category:Large monsters")                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| [Type](/Type "Type")                                                                                 | aspiring flesh, aspiring flesh                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Flags                                                                                                | [No poly](/No_poly "No poly") [Regenerates](/Category:Regenerates "Category:Regenerates") [Stationary](/Stationary "Stationary") [No skeleton](/No_skeleton "No skeleton") [No zombie](/Category:No_zombie "Category:No zombie") [No gen derived](/No_gen_derived "No gen derived") |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | The divided and churning remains of a protean progenitor, striving desperately for form. Whatever they become, the last of their progenitor's power ensure it will be stronger and swifter than any such creature found elsewhere in the dungeon. |

When a protean progenitor dies, it splits into 2-4 **aspiring flesh**.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) After a few turns, an aspiring flesh will transform into a permanently [hasted](/Haste "Haste") and [mighted](/Might "Might") copy of a given monster.

- Aspiring flesh transforms one at a time. The first aspiring flesh takes 2-4 turns to transform. Each flesh thereafter takes 1-2 turns longer than the previous.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)
- All aspiring flesh from the same progenitor will turn into the same type of monster. This monster is determined when the progenitor dies. ("For just a moment, the protean progenitor begins to look like <[monster](/Foo "Foo")>, then it explodes!") The more [HD](/HD "HD") said monster has, the less flesh is created. The HD of chosen monsters is around 12, but can vary greatly ([scorpions](/Scorpion "Scorpion") have been seen to spawn from them.)
- Aspiring flesh can be killed to prevent the monsters from being created.

## Tips & Tricks

- Aspiring flesh can be difficult to destroy in the few turns that it exists for. Try not to focus on it if there are other threats nearby.
- Take note of what monster will spawn from the aspiring flesh. Hasted and mighted [bunyips](/Bunyip "Bunyip") are nothing to scoff at, even for Zot characters.
  - They can turn into just about any [natural](/Natural "Natural") monster, so watch out for odd interactions. For example, they can turn into an [eye of devastation](/Eye_of_devastation "Eye of devastation"), which can strip your willpower as you're next to a [dread lich](/Dread_lich "Dread lich").
- You can use [Yara's Violent Unravelling](/Yara%27s_Violent_Unravelling "Yara's Violent Unravelling") or a [wand of quicksilver](/Wand_of_quicksilver "Wand of quicksilver") to remove the haste and might from aspiring flesh-created monsters.

## History

- Prior to [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), protean progenitors could [see invisible](/See_invisible "See invisible"). Also introduced in this version was the ability to see what the aspiring flesh will turn into simply by inspecting one.
- In [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), protean progenitors and aspiring flesh were introduced.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [mon-death.cc:1335](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.31-b1/crawl-ref/source/mon-death.cc#L1335) (0.31-b1)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [mon-death.cc:1376](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.31-b1/crawl-ref/source/mon-death.cc#L1376) (0.31-b1)

Protean progenitor

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.32: This article is up to date for the latest stable release of Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup.

For a list of all giants, see list of giants.

protean progenitor C 
HP 54-110
HD 14
XP 1307
Speed 14
AC 7
EV 8
Will 120
Attack1 55 (hit: plain)


Resistances

rPois+

Vulnerabilities Silver
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Giant
Type giant, protean progenitor
Flags Warm-blooded
Speaks
See invisible
No poly
Regenerates
No zombie
No gen derived
A gargantuan humanoid of fractured shape from the aeons when the seas were but primordial soup. The many shapeshifters of the dungeon once sloughed off from these unfathomably ancient beings, and when they themselves finally cease, even their remains will give birth one last time to furious monsters.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Tips & Tricks
  • 3 Spells
  • 4 Aspiring flesh
  • 5 Tips & Tricks
  • 6 History
  • 7 References

Useful Info

Protean progenitors are primordial, unstable, and giant monsters. On their own, they are fast, hit hard, regenerate very quickly and cast Irradiate. On death, they will split into aspiring flesh. They appear in the Realm of Zot and the domain of Mnoleg, usually in pairs.

Tips & Tricks

  • Protean progenitors are essentially more dangerous Orb Guardians that appear in pairs. Try to fight them individually.
  • Try not to remain in melee range with them for too long, or you could end up severely contaminated.
  • Due to their very fast regeneration, if you disengage from a battle with them for even a short amount of time they will likely have recovered back to full health.
  • Protean progenitors are vulnerable to silver.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Irradiate (3d25) Wizard flag


Aspiring flesh

aspiring flesh * 
HP 87-177
HD 12
XP 0
Speed 10 (stationary)
AC 2
EV 0
Will Immune



Resistances rDrown

rPois+

Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Amphibious
Intelligence Brainless
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Natural
Size Large
Type aspiring flesh, aspiring flesh
Flags No poly
Regenerates
Stationary
No skeleton
No zombie
No gen derived
The divided and churning remains of a protean progenitor, striving desperately for form. Whatever they become, the last of their progenitor's power ensure it will be stronger and swifter than any such creature found elsewhere in the dungeon.

When a protean progenitor dies, it splits into 2-4 aspiring flesh.[1] After a few turns, an aspiring flesh will transform into a permanently hasted and mighted copy of a given monster.

  • Aspiring flesh transforms one at a time. The first aspiring flesh takes 2-4 turns to transform. Each flesh thereafter takes 1-2 turns longer than the previous.[2]
  • All aspiring flesh from the same progenitor will turn into the same type of monster. This monster is determined when the progenitor dies. ("For just a moment, the protean progenitor begins to look like <monster>, then it explodes!") The more HD said monster has, the less flesh is created. The HD of chosen monsters is around 12, but can vary greatly (scorpions have been seen to spawn from them.)
  • Aspiring flesh can be killed to prevent the monsters from being created.

Tips & Tricks

  • Aspiring flesh can be difficult to destroy in the few turns that it exists for. Try not to focus on it if there are other threats nearby.
  • Take note of what monster will spawn from the aspiring flesh. Hasted and mighted bunyips are nothing to scoff at, even for Zot characters.
    • They can turn into just about any natural monster, so watch out for odd interactions. For example, they can turn into an eye of devastation, which can strip your willpower as you're next to a dread lich.
  • You can use Yara's Violent Unravelling or a wand of quicksilver to remove the haste and might from aspiring flesh-created monsters.

History

  • Prior to 0.32, protean progenitors could see invisible. Also introduced in this version was the ability to see what the aspiring flesh will turn into simply by inspecting one.
  • In 0.31, protean progenitors and aspiring flesh were introduced.

References

  1. ↑ mon-death.cc:1335 (0.31-b1)
  2. ↑ mon-death.cc:1376 (0.31-b1)

rawPage:
{{version032}}
{{list of|giants}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Protean progenitors''' are primordial, [[chaotic|unstable]], and giant monsters. On their own, they are fast, hit hard, regenerate very quickly and cast [[Irradiate]]. On death, they will split into [[#Aspiring flesh|aspiring flesh]]. They appear in the [[Realm of Zot]] and the domain of [[Mnoleg]], usually in pairs.

==Tips & Tricks==
*Protean progenitors are essentially more dangerous [[Orb Guardian]]s that appear in pairs. Try to fight them individually.
*Try not to remain in melee range with them for too long, or you could end up severely [[contamination|contaminated]].
*Due to their very fast regeneration, if you disengage from a battle with them for even a short amount of time they will likely have recovered back to full health.
*Protean progenitors are vulnerable to [[silver]].

{{monster spells}}


==Aspiring flesh==
{{monster info|aspiring flesh}}

When a protean progenitor dies, it splits into 2-4 '''aspiring flesh'''.<ref>{{source ref|0.31-b1|mon-death.cc|1335}}</ref> After a few turns, an aspiring flesh will transform into a permanently [[haste]]d and [[might]]ed copy of a given monster.
*Aspiring flesh transforms one at a time. The first aspiring flesh takes 2-4 turns to transform. Each flesh thereafter takes 1-2 turns longer than the previous.<ref>{{source ref|0.31-b1|mon-death.cc|1376}}</ref>
*All aspiring flesh from the same progenitor will turn into the same type of monster. This monster is determined when the progenitor dies. ("For just a moment, the protean progenitor begins to look like <[[foo|monster]]>, then it explodes!") The more [[HD]] said monster has, the less flesh is created. The HD of chosen monsters is around 12, but can vary greatly ([[scorpion]]s have been seen to spawn from them.)
*Aspiring flesh can be killed to prevent the monsters from being created.

==Tips & Tricks==
*Aspiring flesh can be difficult to destroy in the few turns that it exists for. Try not to focus on it if there are other threats nearby.
*Take note of what monster will spawn from the aspiring flesh. Hasted and mighted [[bunyip]]s are nothing to scoff at, even for Zot characters.
**They can turn into just about any [[natural]] monster, so watch out for odd interactions. For example, they can turn into an [[eye of devastation]], which can strip your willpower as you're next to a [[dread lich]].
*You can use [[Yara's Violent Unravelling]] or a [[wand of quicksilver]] to remove the haste and might from aspiring flesh-created monsters.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.32]], protean progenitors could [[see invisible]]. Also introduced in this version was the ability to see what the aspiring flesh will turn into simply by inspecting one.
*In [[0.31]], protean progenitors and aspiring flesh were introduced.
